content.content: Tl;dr Flop MKR vesting contracts When MKR Flops there is concern that MKR dilution will occur at a depressed MKR price unfavorable to token holders. A possible solution is a new, additional Flop mechanism that auctions off not MKR, but a vesting contract paying MKR over a time period. I think this would incentivize hodlers to buy them at a discount, but maybe at less of a discount than a MKR Flop. I am not proposing it, I want to know why people think this is a good idea or not, and worthy of development resources or not.

content.content: Interesting idea, but I doubt that equilibrium bid price for FLOPs would be higher if we offer bidders an objectively worse token (MKR with vesting restrictions vs regular MKR).

content.content: Agree that anyone buying it will demand a discount vs. regular MKR. In exchange for the discount, Maker is building a portfolio of locked MKR. Wouldn’t that have a DSR-like effect (locking MKR instead of Dai) of increasing scarcity and, all other things equal, MKR price?
